Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2008 06:27AM nicky01 wrote: Hi Melissa: I found a lump when I was 24 - I could feel it and so could the doctor, but the mammogram and ultrasound could not find it.  I also had a lumpectomy and it turned out to be a fibroadenoma and it was benign.  I am glad I got it removed because I had piece of mind.  I am now 38 and in that time since the lumpectomy, lumps have come and gone, breast pain has come and gone and nipple discharge, which I am currently investigating. It really does seem our breast go through a lot of changes, but it is best to get them checked to be on the safe side. I am sure yours will turn out ok.  Believe me, I understand worrying - I think I have worried myself to sickness over the last month about the breast discharge. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Finding a lump at 28 years old melissag0816 ne0n

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2008 05:21PM nicky01 wrote: Yu Yu, I am sooooo sorry to hear your bad news.  Try not to think the worst.  Please try to stay calm until you know more and then you can get it taken care of.  Please keep us posted on your progress. Good luck and try to stay strong.

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2008 07:31AM nicky01 wrote: Hey Ladies: Please update me with the findings.  Ked, good luck with your surgery.  Please let us know what comes of it.  Luckie, please let us know what the results of your biopsy are.  They did not do an ultrasound on me, but the mammogram did not show a papilloma - maybe the doc will look into that.    I am seeing the breast surgeon on Friday.  I was supposed to go Monday, but they pushed it back to Friday.  I can't wait until all of this is over.   Thank you again for responses.  It makes me feel better to know I am not alone. Nicky
Posts.Title: Clear nipple discharge nicky01 nicky01

Posts.Content: nicky01 wrote: Hi everyone.  I am new here, but I read a lot of posts and everyone seems to be very helpful and supportive.  I am writing because I am so worried.  In December I noticed some clear discharge coming out of my left nipple, so I squeezed the nipple and more came out.  I squeezed the right nipple and some clear discharge came out of that one too.  Since then, the right nipple has not leaked and when I squeeze the nipple nothing comes out, so that one is not a problem.   The left nipple still leaks clear fluid once in a while. It seems to happen when it is stimulated i.e. clothing rubbing against nipple or if I press or squeeze the breast. I went to the gyn office and they did a nipple smear, which came back ok. They also did a diagnostic mammogram, which did not show anything.  They did an MRI of the brain because they were looking for a pituitary tumor, which they found.  It is extremely small and my prolactin levels were normal, so the endocrinologist does not think this is causing the discharge, but he is running more bloodwork to look at my hormones. Anyway, in the meantime I am going to a breast surgeon on Monday.  I am so scared.  What if they find breast cancer?  What if it is there, but they haven't found it yet? I have read many sites that say discharge is rarely a sign of cancer, but the articles also say to look into it when the discharge is unilateral, clear and spontaneous.   I am so sick of worrying about this since December..... Would advanced cancer show up on the mammogram?  I know mammograms are not 100%, but I got a digital mammogram and they took extra pictures of just the nipple.  I have no idea what the surgeon is going to say or what other tests I might have.  I am 38 yrs. old and feel like this may be due to hormonal issues, but I worry about breast cancer.  I wonder if they find breast cancer if it is early breast cancer and treatable?   Please help..... Your opinions are welcome.    Thank you for listening. Nicky  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Clear nipple discharge nicky01 nicky01

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2008 11:08PM nicky01 wrote: Thank you for all your support and comments.  This is truly a wonderful site.  I see the breast surgeon on April 18th.  The waiting is definitely the hardest part.  I also have to get bloodwork done on April 16th.  They are checking all of my hormone levels to see if hormones are causing the discharge. I just want to get to the bottom of this.  I want to know either way and have piece of mind (hopefully).  Have faith and God will help us through our tough times.
Posts.Title: Clear nipple discharge nicky01 nicky01

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2008 12:05AM nicky01 wrote: Well, yesterday I had a ductogram and I am pleased to say that everything was normal.  They did not find any masses, etc.  I was soooo happy that I had tears in my eyes.  The ductogram was uncomfortable ( the thought of it still makes me cringe), but it worth having peace of mind. Thank you for all of the support and I will check in periodically to see if I can add anything from my experience. By the way, the doctor assured me that clear nipple discharge usually ends up being a hormonal thing, even if it is unilateral.  She said it RARELY is cancer. Good luck Nicky
Posts.Title: Clear nipple discharge nicky01 nicky01

Posts.Content: nicky01 wrote: When you do a self breast exam do you press really hard to check for lumps and just press lightly?  I wasn't sure if I felt a lump or not.  It kind of feels the same way on both sides.  It almost feels like my muscle around my breast (hard to describe)  Anyway, after poking and prodding I am sore. Just wondering how you do the self breast exam.  Thanks for the info.   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lump question nicky01 Beesie

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2008 08:37PM nicky01 wrote: Just an update.  I went to the breast surgeon today and since she is still able to express the clear discharge from my nipple she wants to get more tests.  I have to get another diagnostic mammogram and a breast mri.  I am nervous about the mri.  I am not scared about the test even though it isn't fun, but I am scared of the results.  She warned me that the mri shows "everything" including cysts, fibroids, tumors, etc.  I am afraid of false positives.  I asked her if they can tell the difference between all of it and she said yes.  I don't want to have to get a biopsy because of something questionable, which I am afraid will happen.   I am sooo frustrated and sick of all of this.  Eight months of this stuff is way too long - especially because they still don't know what is causing it.  The doctor is still leaning towards hormonal issues even though my hormone levels seem normal.  She does not think it is cancer at all, but she wants to rule it out 100%.  We talked about Paget's disease, which she is always a concern with discharge, but I don't have any of the other symptoms i.e. rash, itching, redness, scaliness and flaking.  She said my nipple looked normal.    She did tell me something interesting that I wasn't aware of.  She said our left breast usually feels a little different than the right breast because of increased blood flow.  Our hearts are on our left side of our bodies so it increases our blood flow to the left breast and the left breast is usually a little bigger than the right.  Interesting.....  Anyway, please let me know your stories about breast mri's.  I am very nervous about this.   Thank you again for listening. Nicole
Posts.Title: Question about clear nipple discharge nicky01 nicky01

Posts.Content: nicky01 wrote: I have posted here in the past when my discharge started about 8 months ago and since then I have been through a battery of tests.  I have clear discharge on the left side only.  Initially it leaked on both sides, but quickly stopped on the right side.  Anyway, I did see a breast surgeon and had a mammogram, nipple smear and ductogram - all came out normal.  Never found any lumps. They have chalked it up to hormonal. I did have a brain MRI to look for a pituitary tumor (prolactin) and they did find a very small pituitary tumor, but because there is no prolactin in my blood and because the tumor is so small the endocrinologist is saying that he doesn't think it is causing the discharge.  The breast surgeon isn't so sure that the pituitary tumor isn't causing it.  Anyway, the discharge is periodic and does not happen all of the time.  Also, it doesn't leak a lot of fluid - no clothes staining or anything like that.  It seems to happen more when my nipple is stimulated and clothes are rubbing against it.  It seems to get irritated and then leak a bit.   I take Evening Primrose everyday because I am trying to prevent cysts and I was hoping it could possibly help with the discharge.  The surgeon said it can't hurt and she recommended I take it.  I do see the breast surgeon this Friday, so I will talk to her about all of this again.  It looks like I will be seeing her every 4 months or so for follow up.   I still get scared and wonder what if I have breast cancer, but they just haven't found it.  I don't have any other symptoms but clear leakage every now and then.  Does anyone else have this issue and if so what are your docs doing about it, if anything?  I wish it would just go away because I am so sick of the worry. By the way, I am 38 yrs. old. The radiologist that did my ductogram said that clear fluid is rarely ever cancer.  She said she has only ever seen 1 case of it being cancer in all her years, so that is at least positive.  Even so, I always have that little voice in my head saying something else.  Arggghhhh - very frustrating. Thank you for listening. Nicole    Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Question about clear nipple discharge nicky01 nicky01

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2008 11:25AM nicky01 wrote: Thanks, Tina.  I wonder if the ductogram would have shown ductal hyperplasia?  The ducts all looked normal with no blockages according to the radiologist.  She even showed me the pictures - pretty neat looking.  I will have to bring this up to the breast surgeon on Friday.  The surgeon said she could remove the duct, but that is a last resort.  It doesn't leak that bad that she would do surgery, so we'll see. I did not realize that the Primrose oil had estrogen in it.  Maybe I should stop taking it.  They did a lot of hormone work on me because of my pituitary tumor and my estrogen levels were normal, so maybe I don't need extra.  Thanks
Posts.Title: Question about clear nipple discharge nicky01 nicky01

Posts.Content: nicky01 wrote: Hi Ladies: To make a long story sort of short, last December I had clear discharge coming from my left breast (not a lot and not consistently).  Anyway, I have had 2 diagnostic mammos, US, cytology smear, ductogram, brain mri and a breast mri.  Finally during the breast mri a 4 mm mass showed up right behind my left nipple, which they feel is causing the discharge.  Anyway, after 2 weeks of a few docs looking at the mri results they decided they want to do an MRI guided biopsy.   The are optomistic that it is most likely a papilloma or another benign issue, but they can't completely rule out cancer until the biopsy is done.  I am grateful they are so thorough, but I am scared.  The breast surgeon did say if it turns out be cancer then it looks like a very low grade of cancer and I should be fine after a lumpectomy, but she didn't go into much detail because they are still hoping for a benign diagnosis.  ME TOO.....   I am sooo sick of this.  It is taking me 10 months to get a diagnosis.  I do know regardless of what it is  -  I don't want it in my breast.    Anyway, I hated the MRI the first time around - very uncomfortable.  Now this test can take up to 1 1/2 hours.  The doctor is prescribing me a sedative to take beforehand to calm my nerves, but this is scary.  Has anyone had this procedure done before?   How does the doctor do the biopsy if my breasts are facing down in an MRI machine????  Interesting??  Does it hurt during or afterwards?   She said the results will be in approximately 2 - 3 days, but of course my procedure is on a Thursday, so I have to go through the whole weekend....  I am really scared.   Any input is really appreciated.   Also, has anyone been diagnosed with a low grade breast cancer?  What does that mean?  They only saw the one 3 - 4 mm mass behind my nipple.  Does that mean the rest of my breasts and chest are clear?   Thanks for listening. Nicole  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: MRI Guided Biopsy anyone? nicky01 Nanorama
